title: V-Sync panning screen lag
body:
Hi,

I am playing the league for many years now. Since the beginning I was running on V-Sync on, cause well, this is not FPS game so there was no need to turn it off. It also didn't produce any lag whatsoever.

A week ago I had to reinstall my OS. After the reinstallation, I run LOL just to see the setting etc. Everything was in place but panning screen with mouse was somehow off. I feel like there is a little lag before the screen actually started to move after the mouse pointer hit the edge.

Well, this is something I cannot play with. Colleague was advising to turn off v-sync, which was i reluctant to do, because it never caused any problems.
To my suprise, when it is off, the panning screen lag goes away. Of course it introduces screen tearing which also is not a best solution.

Wanted to ask if anybody else had this problem.

replies.body:
What happens if you disable V-Sync?  It would be a good way to rule out a possible issue with that, but it also sounds like you could have some driver or configuration issues.

The steps in our [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide can help make sure your settings are tuned up to play.  You may also want to try resetting your config to see if some file corruption was causing this response issue:

Log into the game client.
Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
Delete the file  named **game.cfg** and **persistedsettings.json**
Go into a custom game and verify that settings have saved properly.  Leave game to sync settings.

I didn't have time to check it further. 

I was messing with the settings and I forgot that I was always playing on borderless windowed option.
With that option on, there is no lag with screen panning and v-sync on.

Lag with v-sync on is only introduced when playing on full screen.
